facts: Pi is an irrational number, meaning it has an infinite number of decimal places.
Pi has been studied for over 4,000 years!
The symbol π was first used in 1706 by William Jones.
The world record for memorizing Pi is over 70,000 digits!
NASA uses only 15 decimal places of Pi for interplanetary calculations.
The value of Pi was first estimated by Archimedes of Syracuse.
Albert Einstein’s birthday is on Pi Day (March 14th)!
In 2019, Google calculated Pi to 31.4 trillion decimal places.
Pi appears in formulas for circles, waves, and even quantum physics.
